esriDocumentation.additionalInformation: The authoringInfo object is not required with a renderer. It is only used if rendering was generated using the Scene Viewer rendering tools. All snippets provided below show a portion of what is contained within `authoringInfo`. Please refer to the sample snippets in the [authoringInfo visual variable](authoringInfo_visualVariable.md) object for additional help.

description: The authoringInfo is an object containing metadata about the authoring process for creating a renderer object. This allows the authoring clients to save specific overridable settings so that next time it is accessed via an authoring client, their selections are remembered. Non-authoring clients can ignore it. Properties for color/size/transparency sliders, theme selection, classification information, and additional properties are saved within this object.
title: authoringInfo

___classificationMethod.description: Used for classed color or size. The default value is `esriClassifyManual`.

___fields.description: An array of string values representing field names used for creating predominance renderers.

___type.description: Used in case of classed renderers.

___lengthUnit.description: Unit used in user interfaces to display world/map sizes and distances

___visualVariables.description: An array of visualVariable objects containing additional information needed when authoring the renderer.

examples.description: Allows displaying features with different levels of opacity.
examples.title: Attribute Transparency

examples.description: If a layer contains date values, it is possible to use a sequence of proportional symbols to view dates sequentially on a scene.
examples.title: Continuous Size Renderer

examples.description: If a layer contains date values, it is possible to use color to view data sequentially from new to old or before and after a key date.
examples.title: Continuous Color Renderer

examples.description: If a layer contains date or time values, it is possible to use a sequence of proportional symbols to view the age of features. Age reflects the length of time (in seconds, minutes, hours, days, months, or years) from a start date or time to an end date or time.
examples.title: Age-Size Renderer

examples.description: If a layer contains date or time values, it is possible to use color to represent the age of features. Age reflects the length of time (in seconds, minutes, hours, days, months, or years) from a start date or time to an end date or time.
examples.title: Age-Color Renderer

examples.description: This style allows mapping the ratio between two numbers and expresses that relationship as percentages, simple ratios, or overall percentage.
examples.title: Compare Renderer (special color renderer)

examples.description: This style uses transparency to show the relative strength of the predominant attribute for each feature in the layer. The strength, or degree, of predominance is calculated as a percentage of the total value of all the attributes for a given feature.
examples.title: Predominance Renderer

$eref.description: This visual variable is different from `sizeInfo`, `colorInfo`, `transparencyInfo`, and `rotationInfo` as it is an array of visual variables pertaining specifically to authoringInfo and not directly on the [renderer](renderer.md).
$eref.title: AuthoringInfo Visual Variable

___units.description: (This property is used only with age renderers.) Units for startTime and endTime.

___endTime.description: A Unix stamp. Both `startTime` or `endTime` can be fields. If this is the case, their names must be different.

___field.description: The attribute field the user chose in the Smart Mapping gallery. Must be the same as in either `startTime` or `endTime`.

___startTime.description: A Unix time stamp. Both `startTime` or `endTime` can be fields. If this is the case, their names must be different.

___type.description: A string value specifying the type of renderer's visual variable.

___minSliderValue.description: A numeric value indicating the minimum value displayed.

___style.description: (This property is used for comparison rendering). It is used to map the ratio between two numbers. It is possible to express that relationship as percentages, simple ratios, or an overall percentage.

___theme.description: Theme to be used only when working with visual variables of type `colorInfo`. Default is `high-to-low`.

___maxSliderValue.description: A numeric value indicating the maximum value displayed.

$eref.description: A colorRamp object is used to specify a range of colors that are applied to a group of symbols.
$eref.title: Color Ramp

___fromColor.description: Array representing the initial color to start the ramp from.

___colorRamps.description: A multipart color ramp is defined by a list of constituent color ramps.

___type.description: Value indicating the type of colorRamp.

___algorithm.description: Algorithm used for calculating the ramp.

___toColor.description: Array representing the final color to end the ramp with.

___standardDeviationInterval.description: Use this property if the classificationMethod is `esriClassifyStandardDeviation`.
